meanings.definition: In a flowery or elaborate manner
meanings.sent1: She spoke floridly, using many fancy words to describe the simple story.
meanings.sent2: The author wrote floridly, adding unnecessary details to the plot.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked floridly, making the audience laugh with his overly dramatic gestures.
meanings.sent4: Her speech flowed floridly, like a river of colorful words cascading through the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted floridly, creating a masterpiece of vibrant hues and intricate patterns.

meanings.definition: Showing a red or flushed complexion
meanings.sent1: After running, his face looked floridly red from the exertion.
meanings.sent2: The sunburn left her skin looking floridly flushed and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The embarrassed student blushed floridly when called to the front of the class.
meanings.sent4: The tomato in the garden grew floridly red, ripe and ready to be picked.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a floridly flushed face, capturing the intensity of the emotion.

meanings.definition: Excessively ornate or intricate in style
meanings.sent1: The floridly decorated room overwhelmed visitors with its excessive embellishments.
meanings.sent2: Her writing style was floridly ornate, filled with unnecessary adjectives and descriptions.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated floridly, with intricate designs and elaborate frosting.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with floridly blooming flowers, each petal more detailed than the last.
meanings.sent5: The costume was floridly extravagant, covered in sequins and feathers from head to toe.
